titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Newman Levy Archive
ca. 1914-1960
MSS 041
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Luke Martin. Derived from the document levy.html

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2009-06-24T12:11-0400

did.abstract: Newman Levy (1888-1966) was a lawyer and author. The Newman Levy Papers inlcude manuscripts of his articles, book reviews, drama, fiction, verse, and materials related to an unpublished biography of Franklin P. Adams

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into six series:

Series I: Articles
Series II: Book Reviews
Series III: Drama
Series IV: Fiction
Series V: Verse
Series VI: Biographical materials collected by Franklin P. Adams for his biography of Levy.
Materials are arranged alphabetically within each series.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: The Newman Levy Papers were donated to NYU by The Players Club in December 1991.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of 7 boxes of manuscript material of articles, book reviews, drama, fiction, verse, and an unpublished biography of Franklin P. Adams, including some letters written to Levy by people who knew Adams.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); The Newman Levy Papers; MSS 041; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open to researchers. Appointments are necessary for the use of manuscript and archival collections.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Collection use is subject to all copyright laws. Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the Director of Fales Library and Special Collections. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu. or call 212 998 2596.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Newman Levy was born in 1888. His father was the well-known New York criminal lawyer Abraham Levy. Newman Levy graduated from New York University Law school in 1911, and practiced law until 1961. He was an assistant district attorney for New York County from 1916 to 1919. Levy also wrote light verse and skits for Broadway revues. His books inlcude Gay but Wistful and the autobiography My Double Life: Adventures in Law and Letters. He died in New York in 1966.
